verses.text:
We would see Jesus, for the shadows lengthen
Across this little landscape of our life;
We would see Jesus, our weak faith to strengthen
For the last weariness, the final strife.

We would see Jesus, the great rock foundation
Whereon our feet were set with sovereign grace;
Nor life nor death, with all their agitation,
Can thence remove us if we see His face.

We would see Jesus; yet the spirit lingers
Round the dear object it has loved so long,
And earth from earth can scarce unclasp her fingers;
Our love to Jesus makes our love more strong.
